name: Eliza Lodge

reviews.title: money money money
reviews.text: We booked our flight with ryanair. 2pence each, there and back, a bargain!!! That was the only saving we made. Of course, we trawled through tripadvisor for hotels, and decided on Eliza Lodge Hotel, £90 for the night, which considering Dublin prices was great. The hotel is on Wellington Quay, opposite the Fitzwilliam Hotel, and had a great view of the Liffey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small, but had a huge bed, which we found was actually twin beds pushed together,it was fine really. The bathroom was nice,small, but had a good shower. The only drawback was the sink didn't drain easily, but seeing we were only there for one night, we didn't complain.
reviews.title: Graet Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had hairdrier iron/board tea/coffee kettle etc, plenty hanging space and drawers, all you need. And toiletries in bathroom.
reviews.title: Dublin Delight

likes.liked: — the location and the service at reception

reviews.title: Thought it was great!
reviews.text: We decided to visit the guiness storehouse, and duly walked all the way there, which was easy enough, as long as you have a map, which we got at the tourist board. 14 euros later we were in,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (that was each, by the way) (mmsturtles,$6 in2007? inflation?)
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, A Few downsides though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say. Maybe this was one of the best hotel in Dublin. It could be. That doesn't mean I liked it! The room was nice and large. The hotel has a wonderful location, right in the middle of Temple Bar. Little bit of noise in the night, ok, but it is lovely to live the city. The room wasn't cleaned enough, in my opinion. Didn't like the smell of the sheets and towels, as well. Breakfast is not a buffet, you'll find these bored and not so kind waitress that will serve you as long as they want to!
reviews.title: Not so bad, not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say this hotel was awful. But I am sure I'll never go there back again.
reviews.title: cute place, well located

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on our honeymoon. The location was great, we had a room overlooking the Liffey River and we were right in Temple Bar. It was 130 euros a night for a queen bed room, the room was small, but very clean and nicely decorated. SHower was strong and the balcony was a nice perk to go out and take pictures of Dublin. The people working there were really nice, helped me out when I was looking for clubs to go to and also very helpful with directions. Breakfast, (included), was very good, plenty of food. I thought it was a good value being Dublin and I was not suprised by the size of the room for the money we paid. But it was tricky to fit all of our luggage in there! Would recommend it, maybe not comfortable for a long stay, but for one or two nights, definitely.
reviews.title: Fabulous location

likes.disliked: — Small room- but not a major problem

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastically located for temple bar and has great views of the Liffey. the room was small but not uncomfortably so and the hotel was immaculate. The breakfast was great and staff very very helpful. If I went to dublin again i wouldn't hesitate to re-book
reviews.title: Lodge on the Liffey

reviews.text: I stayed at the Eliza Lodge for three nights with my wife and baby. I chose this hotel for its superb location, and wasn't disappointed. Dublin is a small enough city to be able to see pretty much everything on foot from this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mr & Mrs Localshopper made a brief (but very enjoyable) visit to Dublin earlier this week. Despite an early arrival (9.30 am) Eliza Lodge were able to accommodate us there and then with a room facing the Liffey. Clean rooms in good condition, nice breakfast, friendly staff and a very keen price for Dublin.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Eliza Lodge was exactly what we had expected. We booked the top corner room with the balcony. It was a beautiful view and fun to people watch. The room was small, but comfortable. I highly recommend this room. We walked to the nearby Temple Bar area, Grafton Street, even to the Guiness Brewery - it was quite a walk, but a beautiful day for a walk along the river. We arrived in Dublin early, caught the bus into town, then walked to The Eliza Lodge. They stored our luggage until we could check in at 1:00.
reviews.title: Great location, Incredible View

reviews.text: first time we stayed at this centrally located hotel and would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Dublin.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a small penthouse room for 4 nights and found it was very good value for money. Room was small but clean and had great views over the Liffey. Staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast, included in the price, was more than sufficient as they offered you choice between full Irish or contintal.
reviews.title: Quirky little hotel rooms with a river view, but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eliza Lodge is not a Hotel per se, so don't expect a welcome desk. You enter by the restaurant downstairs and then you're directed towards a usually unmanned reception desk.
reviews.title: Not worth the price
Superb
reviews.text: We were a party of 6 ladies who stayed at the Eliza Lodge last weekend - we can't speak highly enough about ALL THE STAFF - they were all so polite, helpful, happy nothing a bother. We were so impressed by the standard of the bedrooms, clean, tidy and lovely comfortable beds. Can't wait to go back again

We booked this hotel on the strength of other reviews posted and we were not disappointed. We arrived really at 9.30 a.m. as our flight was early and although, obviously, our room wasn't ready we were able to leave our luggage there and go exploring. We checked in at 12.30 and were shown to our room. Although small, the room was exceptionally clean, had all facilities you would expect in a hotel and the view was over the quays. The room was very bright and the temperature in the room was just right - very unusual for hotel rooms. The shower was gorgeous and hot. We returned to the hotel after a night on the tiles and we had no problems sleeping. Breakfast was served the next day in the restaraunt and was very nice.
reviews.title: Will be returning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will be returning to Dublin and will definately be staying in Eliza Lodge but we will stay for more than one night.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not for those looking for a luxuriously bg room with spa facilities in a quiet location but for those looking for a nice hotel in a very central area this is the place. We will be back
reviews.title: Watch Out for Credit Card Chrages

reviews.text: We used the internet to search for hotels and found this gem. We checked it out on advisor and decided to book. We couldn't have been happier! The rooms are bright and clean. All have views over the River Liffey in downtown Dubblin. Located right in Temple Bar makes it close to great Pubs and restuarants. It has it's own eating facility, the Eliza Blue, which is very good. The breakfasts are outstanding and great value. The management and staff are professional, coureous and friendly. We were concerned by reports that it may be noisy due to it's location. This hotel is not huge, it has 18 rooms.(I think.). You are not high above the street and because you are in the City center you will here the sounds of the city.It's pretty rare not to here city sounds unless you're 20 floors up! We were there a few days before St. Patricks day and festivities were starting up. I have no complaints at all about noise. Easy to reach from the Airport, hop on the 748 bus just outside the airports entrance and it drops you of at Aston Quay, about 2 blocks east of the Eliza. If you are going to Dublin and are looking for a clean, comfortable, well managed hotel in a superior central location, look no further, the Eliza Lodge is where you want to go. We are planning our next trip and the Eliza is our Hotel in Dublin.
reviews.title: Eliza's corner has pros and cons

description: Contemporary 4-story Hotel located in Temple Bar area, near Grafton Street, St Stephen's Green & Trinity College.
